revised_title: On the Earth's Rigidity and Tides
tldr: The author, William Thomson, discusses the rigidity of the Earth and its effect on the phenomena of tides, precession, and nutation. He argues that the Earth must be extremely rigid, more so than steel, to account for the observed tidal and rotational phenomena. This rigidity supports the idea that the Earth's solid crust is much thicker than previously thought, possibly over 2000 miles thick.
